system_name: CollectPro Payment Collection Workflow Management System
description: End-to-end workflow management system for managing payment collections from invoice creation through customer notification, collection assignment, follow-ups, dispute handling, receipt confirmation, reconciliation, and closure. Designed for production use with role-based access, master data lookups, and sequential stage tracking with Planned/Actual/Delay for each milestone.

sheets.name: Payment Collection Workflow

columns.name: Collection Case ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for the collection case (primary key)

columns.name: Overall Remarks
columns.description: General remarks across the case lifecycle

columns.name: Customer Name
columns.description: Customer name (auto from master or captured)

columns.name: Outstanding Amount
columns.description: Current outstanding amount at case creation

columns.name: Notification Reference ID
columns.description: Message ID / ticket ID from channel provider

columns.name: ShortExcess Amount
columns.description: Difference between expected and received amount

columns.name: Final Outstanding Amount
columns.description: Outstanding amount at closure (should be 0 for paid closure)

stages.stage_description: Create/confirm invoice details, validate customer and terms, and open a collection case with initial aging and risk flags.
Send invoice/due reminder via selected channel(s) and capture delivery/acknowledgement details.
Assign the case to a collector/team with ownership, escalation path, and target contact schedule.
Perform follow-ups, record customer responses, capture promise-to-pay (PTP) commitments, and monitor adherence.
If customer raises a dispute/query, log it, route to resolver, track resolution and approvals before continuing collection.
Confirm payment received (full/partial), capture receipt details, and validate against invoice/outstanding.
Match receipt to bank statement/ledger, confirm reconciliation status, and handle mismatches.
Close the case after full settlement or approved write-off, capture closure reason, and finalize reporting fields.

sheets.description: Primary workflow sheet tracking the full payment collection lifecycle per receivable/invoice with sequential stages and SLA monitoring.

sheets.name: Customer Master
sheets.description: Customer reference data for collections, contacts, and credit attributes.

sheets.name: Invoice Master
sheets.description: Invoice reference data used to create/validate collection cases and prevent duplicates.

sheets.name: Bank Account Master
sheets.description: Company bank accounts used for receiving and reconciliation.

sheets.name: Dispute Reason Master
sheets.description: Standard dispute/query reasons for consistent reporting.

sheets.name: Status Master
sheets.description: Standard statuses for Overall Status, Case Status, Reconciliation Status, Closure Status.

sheets.name: Aging Bucket Master
sheets.description: Aging bucket definitions used for receivable classification.

sheets.name: Channel Master
sheets.description: Communication channels for notifications and follow-ups.

sheets.name: Dropdowns
sheets.description: Centralized dropdown values for consistent data entry across the system.

sheets.name: Import Dump - Bank Statement
sheets.description: Optional import sheet for bank statement lines used during reconciliation.
